definition: lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things

sentences.english: But I AM cast on an island, where I see no wild beasts to hurt me, as I saw on the coast of Africa.
sentences.chinese: 在我所流落的孤島上，沒有我在非洲看到的那些猛獸。

sentences.english: A person that does not get online, often inspect a network to be great scourges .
sentences.chinese: 一個從來不上網的人，常常視網絡爲洪水猛獸。

sentences.english: It is generally speaking a feared and evil beast.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，龍是一種邪惡而可怖的猛獸。

sentences.english: Seconds left , they bring it up , T-Mac rips like an animal.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒時間了，麥迪扯開防守像頭猛獸。

sentences.english: The beast can release a bizarre hydrosonic shriek that stuns its prey.
sentences.chinese: 這種猛獸能發出一種奇怪的水聲波尖叫，震暈獵物。

sentences.english: Top-down discrimination, such as a scourge, was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 自上而下的歧視如洪水猛獸，一發不可收拾。

sentences.english: For them, the dragon is an aggressive monster.
sentences.chinese: 對他們來說，龍是一種猙獰的猛獸。

sentences.english: They are human beings, not a scourge and the god of plague.
sentences.chinese: 他們也是人，並非洪水猛獸和瘟神。

sentences.english: They will also investigate on how the victims entered the forbidden zone.
sentences.chinese: 警方稱將重點調查這對父子如何順利進入了猛獸區。

sentences.english: Despite standing over two meters in height, the wampa ice creature is nonetheless a stealthy predator.
sentences.chinese: 儘管身高兩米多，但萬帕冰獸卻是一種潛行猛獸。

sentences.english: Dinewan the EmuBralagah the Brolga were two such animals.
sentences.chinese: 其中鴯鶓代萬和澳洲鶴布拉咖這樣的兩頭巨型猛獸。

sentences.english: You can see the wild animals living in the wild in the Hainan Tropical Wildlife Garden.
sentences.chinese: 在海南熱帶野生動植物園可以看到在野外生活的猛獸。

sentences.english: I love that phrasing. "Regarded as devils to distract us."
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡那句“被當做會讓我們分心的猛獸。”

sentences.english: Gating the first human, but in order to prevent violation of reptiles beast.
sentences.chinese: 人類最初設門，只是爲了防止爬蟲猛獸的侵害。

sentences.english: Howard was a monster on both ends of the floor during his prime.
sentences.chinese: 在他的巔峯霍華德攻防兩端都是頭猛獸。

sentences.english: He jumps into a well to avoid being caught.
sentences.chinese: 他跳進一口井裏面，想躲過猛獸的追捕。

definition: to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
